title: Connes' interpretation of the Standard Model and massive neutrinos
abstract: Massive neutrinos can be accommodated into the noncommutative geometry reinterpretation of the Standard Model. The constrained Standard Model Lagrangian is computed anew under the assumption of nonzero neutrino masses. This gives the ``prediction" of a mass for the Higgs particle somewhat higher than in the vanishing neutrino mass case.
